components.label: Text Area
components.defaultValue:
WHEREAS:

A The Ministry of Advanced Education (“the Ministry”) is responsible for the administration of:

(a) the Canada Student Loans Program in accordance with agreements under the Canada Student Loan

Act, R.S.C. 1985, c. S-23 and Canada Student Financial Assistance Act, S.C. 1994, c. 28; and

(b) the British Columbia Student Assistance Program (“StudentAid BC”) authorized by British Columbia

OIC 1252/2000;

B StudentAid BC financial assistance is available only to students enrolled in StudentAid BC approved

programs at institutions with StudentAid BC designation;

C The Ministry designates institutions with StudentAid BC designation in accordance with the Pan-

Canadian Designation Policy Framework and the StudentAid BC Policy Manual;

D The Institution and programs must be approved by either or both of the following to be an institution

with StudentAid BC designation:

(a) the Registrar must have approved the Designated Institution’s location(s) and the programs offered

under the Private Training Act and the institution must hold a designation certificate under the Private

Training Act;

(b) the Minister of Advanced Education must have approved the Institution’s location(s) and programs

under the Degree Authorization Act.

E The Institution has applied for designation as a StudentAid BC Designated Institution pursuant to the

terms of this Designation Agreement (“Agreement”).



In consideration of the mutual covenants in this Agreement, the Province and the Institution (together,

“the Parties” or individually, a “Party”) agree as follows:



1.0 Entire Agreement

1.1 This Agreement, including the Schedules listed below, constitutes the entire Agreement between the

Parties.

(a) Schedule A: StudentAid BC Policy Manual, as amended from time to time, which is available on the

StudentAid BC website at: https://studentaidbc.ca/school-officials

(b) Schedule B: StudentAid BC Administrative Manual, as amended from time to time, which is available

on the website at: https://studentaidbc.ca/school-officials

(c) Schedule C: Enrolment Signing Officer and Eligibility Signing Officer Information

(d) Schedule D: Information Sharing Agreement



2.0 Defined Terms

2.1 Definitions for terms used in this Designation Agreement are set out below:

(a) Agreement means this Designation Agreement and the Schedules listed in section 1.1 of this

Agreement.

(b) Approved Program means programs that meet the program eligibility criteria as set out in Schedule

A, Chapter 2 (StudentAid BC Policy Manual).

(c) Designated Institution has the same definition as in Schedule A (StudentAid BC Policy Manual).

(d) Eligible Student means students that meet the student eligibility criteria as set out in Schedule A,

Chapter 3 (StudentAid BC Policy Manual).

(e) Ministry means the British Columbia Ministry of Advanced Education, or the ministry of the

Government of British Columbia responsible for administration of the StudentAid BC program;

(f) Premises includes any locations where the institution provides instruction to students, and any

locations where the institution conducts business activities associated with operating a post-secondary

institution.



3.0 Term

3.1 This Agreement may be terminated by either Party by providing 90 days written notice to the other

Party.

3.2 This Agreement is immediately terminated if any one or more of the following occurs:

(a) The sale of the Institution such that the Registrar of the Private Training Institutions Branch

determines that a new designation certificate is required under the Private Training Act;

(b) The closure of the Institution;

(c) The termination of the Institution's StudentAid BC designation.



4.0 Designation

4.1 Provided the Institution remains a Designated Institution, the Ministry, on behalf of the Province of

British Columbia, will make student financial assistance available to students who meet the following

requirements:

(a) the student is an Eligible Student;

(b) the student is enrolled in an Approved Program;

(c) the Approved Program is provided by the Institution at a location approved by StudentAid BC.

4.2 The Institution will administer the financial assistance received for Eligible Students in accordance

with the terms of this Agreement.



5.0 Maintaining Designation

5.1 During the term of this Agreement, the Institution must:

(a) comply with the terms of this Agreement;

(b) comply with all applicable laws, including, but not limited to the Canada Student Financial Assistance

Act, the Private Training Act, the Degree Authorization Act, the Freedom of Information and Protection

of Privacy Act and the Personal Information Protection Act;

(c) hold a designation certificate issued by the Private Training Institutions Branch under the authority of

the Private Training Act, and/or ministerial consent under section 4 of the Degree Authorization Act, as

applicable.



6.0 Designated Institution Administration of Student Financial Assistance

6.1 At the request of the Ministry and subject to applicable laws, the Institution must provide any or all

of the following information concerning an Eligible Student to the Ministry:

(a) academic performance, including transcripts;

(b) attendance records;

(c) student enrolment contract with the Institution;

(d) mailing address; and

(e) phone number.

6.2 The Institution must provide the Ministry with the names of all employees designated as Enrolment

Signing Officer(s) and Eligibility Signing Officer(s) as defined in Schedule B (StudentAid BC Administration

Manual) in the form attached as Schedule C (Enrolment Signing Officer and Eligibility Signing Officer

Information) to this Agreement at the time the Designation Agreement is submitted for approval.

6.3 Prior to the removal of a designated Enrolment Signing Officer or Eligibility Signing Officer, or as

soon as is practical, the Institution will notify the Ministry in writing of the name(s) of the person(s)

whose signing authority is removed and the date upon which such removal becomes effective.

6.4 Prior to the designation of any new Enrolment Signing Officer or new Eligibility Signing Officer, the

Institution will provide the Ministry with an updated Schedule C (Enrolment Signing Officer and Eligibility

Signing Officer Information) form including the name(s) of the new Enrolment Signing Officer(s) or

Eligibility Signing Officer(s).



7.0 Inspection and Compliance

7.1 For the purposes of an inspection, the Institution agrees to allow Ministry staff to attend at the

Institution's Premises and agrees to cooperate fully with those Ministry staff in the conduct of their

duties under this Agreement.

7.2 Ministry staff conducting an inspection may at any time:

(a) enter the Institution's Premises;

(b) require that a document or any other thing be produced for inspection at a location specified by

Ministry staff;

(c) examine a document or any other thing directly or indirectly related to the StudentAid BC program or

to an Eligible Student;

(d) require that a copy be provided of any document or thing identified in subsections 7.3(b) or 7.3(c) of

this Agreement;

(e) use the Institution's data storage, information processing or retrieval devices or systems that are

normally used in carrying on business in the Premises to produce a record in readable form;

(f) question a person at a location specified by Ministry staff; or

(g) arrange for the conduct of an external forensic audit, at the expense of the Institution.

7.3 During the term of this Agreement and for two years following the termination of this Agreement,

the Ministry may conduct an inspection in accordance with sections 7.1 and 7.2 of this Agreement.



8.0 Compliance Enforcement

8.1 Any breach of the terms of this Agreement by the Institution, or if the Ministry is otherwise of the

opinion that it is necessary for the proper administration of student financial assistance, may result in

the Ministry taking any or all of the following actions:

(a) consult with the Institution in person and/or in writing;

(b) require compliance within a specific period of time, and evidence of compliance;

(c) require additional or more frequent monitoring or reporting, at the expense of the Institution;

(d) refuse to provide financial assistance to students registered in some or all of the programs or courses

at the Institution;

(e) terminate the Institution’s status as a Designation Institution; or

(f) pursue any other legal remedies available to the Ministry.



9.0 General

9.1 Any notice of communication contemplated by this Agreement shall be sufficiently given if:

sent by email to or by:

The Ministry at designat@gov.bc.ca

The Institution at [As listed in the institution profile on the partner portal]

Sent by fax to:

The Ministry at (250) 387-1377

The Institution at [As listed in the institution profile on the partner portal]

Mailed by prepaid registered mail to:

The Ministry:

Post-Secondary Audit & Accountability Branch

Ministry of Advanced Education

PO Box 9157 Stn Prov Govt

Victoria BC V8W 9H2

The Institution at [As listed in the institution profile on the partner portal]

9.2 Either Party may notify the other of a substitute email contact, fax number or address from time to

time.

9.3 Any notice mailed by prepaid registered mail is deemed to be received two days after mailing.

9.4 This Agreement is not assignable or transferrable by the Institution.



This Agreement has been executed on behalf of the Ministry by its legally authorized representative and

on behalf of the Institution by its legally authorized representative.

components.label: By clicking the box, you confirm that you are legally authorized by the Institution to enter into an agreement on behalf of the Institution and that the Institution agrees to the terms and conditions of the Agreement.

validate.customMessage: The conditions for the the designation agreement must be accepted
